meanings.definition: In a comforting or soothing manner.
meanings.sent1: She patted his back consolingly after he lost the game.
meanings.sent2: He smiled consolingly at his friend who was feeling down.
meanings.sent3: The puppy licked his face consolingly, trying to cheer him up.
meanings.sent4: The warm cup of tea hugged her insides consolingly on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The gentle music played consolingly in the background, easing her worries.

meanings.sent1: Her consolingly words helped him feel better after a tough day.
meanings.sent2: The consolingly hug from his mother made everything seem okay.
meanings.sent3: The consolingly blanket wrapped around her felt like a warm hug.
meanings.sent4: The consolingly presence of his best friend calmed his nerves before the speech.
meanings.sent5: The consolingly gesture of holding hands brought them closer in their time of need.
